intro: Boehmeria bullata subsp. notobullata, commonly known as the southern nettle, is a perennial herb native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its fibrous stalks have been used traditionally for making textiles and paper.
